course.subject: SOSC
course.name: Gender and Society
course.description: This course studies how pervasive gender is in organizing our social life. We shall examine how gender organizes everything from our sense of personal identity to our daily face-to-face interactions, and how gender is embedded in institutions such as the family, labor market, media, and the state. The aim is to introduce students to a sociological perspective of thinking about gender.

reviews.author: PTMS
reviews.comment_content:
講gender 係社會入面嘅議題
唔一定係性別不平等 仲有同性戀，性別定型，兩性關係都有提及
Overall 係一個有趣嘅course 嚟，會用sociological approach 去睇性別同社會嘅關係，個人覺得係目前讀過咁多sosc course 嚟講比較有趣嘅一個。
Topic 主要係:
1) PART I: BIOLOGY, SEX AND GENDER
2) PART II: INEQUALITY IN EVERYDAY LIFE
3)PART III MEN AND WOMEN IN THE WORKPLACE AND AT HOME
4)PART IV: MEN AND WOMEN IN INTIMATE RELATIONSHIPS
5)PART V: MEN AND WOMEN IN THE GLOBAL ECONOMY
詳細可以睇其他人嘅review
reviews.comment_teaching:
好輕鬆嘅
佢有好多片會播 有好多discussion
係Interaction 比較多嘅professor
不過我自己覺得喺一班80人嘅班房咁interactive 有啲怪 可能我唔慣
除此之外 佢accent 同語速我覺得係幾好 基本上唔會跟唔上
reviews.comment_grading:
SOSC 嚟講爛grade
科大嚟講正常
佢個計分方法係:
Assignment (and presentation if applicable)   25%
Midterm Exam   35%
Final Exam (cumulative) 40%
如果上堂有講嘢就加分 最多加多10分
兩個exam 啲人都幾高分下 兩次個mean 都70尾左右
個人覺得啲exam幾易 甚至有啲只係common sense 所以我諗成科都唔算太難
不過 佢grading 就偏爛
我自己 midterm above 0.8 sd Final above 1 sd project max (無mean同sd) 得B+
不過有groupmate 同我差唔多分 佢就有A- (我諗佢parti 2~3分 我0~1分)
我覺得B range 唔難但要 A range 就一定要上堂講嘢 (對於一個極度introvert嘅人嚟講要係80人面前講嘢真係好難)
對比其他sosc course 嚟講真係偏爛grade 除非你好有興趣/你係上堂好積極嘅人如果唔係都要有B range 封頂嘅覺悟
reviews.comment_workload:
冇乜
佢話上堂前要睇reading 但我覺得上堂之後再睇會更易吸收 (因為powerpoint 係reading 嘅summary) 不過如果你好想要parti就一定要睇 因為佢問啲問題都同reading 到提過
Exam 記得睇晒啲reading PowerPoint 背晒入去基本上above mean 冇難度
Project 就depends
佢做嘅topic 3抽1
全部都係講緊男同女係買嘢嘅時候價錢嘅分別
簡單嘅有文具/hair salon依啲
難嘅有car insurance/電子零售(黃金個啲唔係連鎖店個隻)
所以depends
Overall 上堂專心啲 project exam 用3~4日溫我覺得都足夠

reviews.author: Law~
reviews.title: Enrol only if you enjoy Grove's style
reviews.comment_content:
Although the course name is "Gender and Society", the courses spends a great deal of time in raising examples of "gender stereotypes". He spent a lot of time playing videos from YouTube, which primarily outlines the "inequality" between male and female. He did not complement the videos with sociological theories and he just opens the floor for vague class discussion.

I am expecting some more sociological perspectives but they only take up very small portion of the course.

This course is more like 1000-level. As a SBM student, I find it so similar to Business Ethics classes, in terms of quality, delivery, depth and intellectuality.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Unrewarding.

I think a previous SOSC1662 review on Grove's teaching perfectly describes my conclusion to him. That review attracts >20 "helpful" clicks which is indeed very rare on UST SPACE. Other reviews with similar comments can also be found from Grove's SOSC1850 reviews.

For most of the time, the concepts are spoon-fed to students and we are required to remember what he said and to recall them during examinations.
reviews.comment_grading:
Aligning with other reviewers on UST SPACE, Groves' courses are usually poor in grade.

It's totally right.

The exams in this course are poorly designed. Each constitutes only 30 MCQ (--> requiring to recall what he said and agreed) and very few fill-in the blank questions (--> requiring to recall what he said and agreed).

In exam, we were asked "what is meant by sticky rice in gay community?", "which country / region has the highest % of female inmates?", and "why when A (married to B) is male, A and B's baby call B as daddy" ......

Most of the students get high marks easily, but it fails to distinguish which students are more sociologically able and who aren't.  

For me, I fell into C-range in this course, but I have received far better grades from other sociology courses in HKUST. I guess that can already tell why you shouldn't take this course.
reviews.comment_workload:
Fair Workload.

Only one mid-term exam, one final exam, and one group project (poorly designed and not academic at all).

reviews.author: eu
reviews.title: Gender is a huge issue
reviews.comment_content: You'd find that there re still serious gender discrimination and inequality everywhere even in the modern society today.I learn interesting facts and cases on the topic. I like the whole structure of the class, it encourages questioning and creative ideas.
reviews.comment_teaching: Interactive teaching style, nice English, guest lectures and video watching all the time
reviews.comment_grading: SO-SO, probably its easy to get good scores in the exam and it all depends on your project and ability to yo(someone really good at it every lesson)
reviews.comment_workload: Okay, try to find a better topic for your project so as to make it fun

reviews.author: Anita Chen8
reviews.comment_content: Very Interesting! Give you a general idea about gender issue. The questions professor asked in the class always prompted me to rethink some phenomenon we're used to in the society.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor is very nice and knowledgeable. He is open minded and willing to answer your questions.
reviews.comment_grading: People said the grading is good but I think it's just okay. Got more than 1 SD above mean in midterm and slightly above
reviews.comment_workload: Not too much. Only one group project, midterm, and final. For the group project, you can submit either video or ppt. And you don't have to present to the class. You only have to sit in front of the classroom to answer ppl's questions. ( if your group is chosen)

reviews.author: Jenasdf
reviews.comment_content: Broad enough content to be covered in a semester. Gives a thorough insight through fundamental concepts and explains in a way that is easy to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching: Instructor stays on track with the syllabus and brings in many guest talkers for a wider range of experience. He's quite friendly and not assertive at all, so you will be comfortable attending the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading doesn't seem to be too harsh, but contributing to the class discussions help. Midterm&final and group work seem to be of equal importance.
reviews.comment_workload: Be careful who you choose to be in a group with, but usually not much workload. Reading all the given materials in time will be helpful.

reviews.author: uiygniw
reviews.comment_content:
topic1: biology, sex and gender
topic2: inequality in everyday life
topic3: men and women in the workplace and at home
topic4: men and women in intimate relationships
topic5: men and women in the global economy

The purpose of this courses is to let us develop a sociological mindfulness about the importance of gender in society. We will view gender as the product of culture, groups, and organizations. We are also required to pay attention to behaviors and ways of thinking that are so taken-for-granted that we fail to question them.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor always encourages class discussion and is willing to answer students' questions, both in class and outside of class. He usually uses powerpoint to present his points and plays videos to illustrate opinions on the topic from different stakeholders. However, he is very strict on the use of mobile phones and laptop computers.
reviews.comment_grading:
assignment and presentation    25%
midterm exam                           35%
final exam(cumulative               40%

my score:
midterm: 91/100     mean: 76.7      SD: 14.7
group project: 90/100   mean: 85.98    SD: 6.5
final: 79/100       mean: 71.87      SD:12.89

final grade: B+
reviews.comment_workload: There are required readings every week and the content will be discussed in class.  The group project will be conducted in a group of 5-6 students. We need to conduct a social experiment to break gender norms and write a report or edit a video on other people's reaction towards our experiment, which is quite time-consuming.

reviews.author: faebaebee
reviews.comment_content:
The content are interesting and covers a wide range of topics.

1. Biology sex and gender (include 5 subchapters)
2. Inequality in everydaylife (5 subchapters)
3. Men and women in the work place and the home (5 subchapters)
4. Men and women in intimate relationships (7 subchapters)
5. Men and women in the global economy (1 subchapter)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor requires students to do pre-lesson reading, but it only matters if you want to answer questions in class in order to get participation marks.

He did not just read powerpoints but always initiate discussions during the class, which students are always willing to put up their hands to answer his questions.

But he is really straight towards late comers (with a horrible staring) and little class recordings were provided if you miss the class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 1: 35%
Quiz 2 : 40% (cumulative), is a final exam actually...
Assignment 20% (including peer review)
Participation: 5% (by answer question not by attending the class)

Quiz 1: 31/35
Quiz 2: 29/37
Assignment (group project): 19/20
Participation: 0/5 (I never answered any questions.)

I got an A in this course, but I won't say it's easy to get good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Quiz 1 is pretty easy but be careful with quiz 2. As mention in teaching part, this course requires students to read pre-lesson materials. It asked a lot of questions from the pre-lesson materials. And be prepared for the quiz 2 as 23 subchapters are covered in total.

Assignment is a group project, with a group of 4-5 people (good teamates matters, otherwise you willl suffer). The topic of the project is: Covid 19 Gendered Media Exercise. You have to write a report with your groupmates (no specific word count but 5-10 pages of A4 are suggested). You may have to do presentation in the class.

The main workload is only from the group project. If you want to obtain a good grade, better attend all the classes as the important points are only available from professors (the key points to answers questions in the exam) and you have to get the particiaption marks by answering questions (but I never did).

Overall, not much homework but it do requires a lot to time to prepare for the classes.

reviews.author: JNC
reviews.title: A good Common Core for learning
reviews.comment_content:
Very nice.
Instead of digging very deep into every single topic, we kind of go through every aspect of gender issues in a decent way. Many of the content blew my mind as well, making me to re-think my perceptions towards different things.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Nice.
He included a lot of interesting documentaries/short clips to make the lectures fun. I enjoy attending lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
I got A-, midterm above 0.5SD, final above 1SD/
It is pretty good.
I did not spend a lot of time to revise and the method of revision is very simple - watch every lecture video(x2 speed) and jot notes. Never read any of the readings.
Just make sure that you remember and understand every concept word and the core of the readings.
reviews.comment_workload: normal cc workload

reviews.author: Squidgy
reviews.title: Most influential course in UST
reviews.comment_content:
Just look at other reviews.
The course gives me a very different view towards many social issues, not only about gender but also the mindset we should have when we meet a controversial topic in the future.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Very nice. He is a native speaker and delivers in a very understandable way. Although the lecture slides were a little bit useless since they are filled with photos, the content is still very attractive and intriguing.

He also invited experts to give speech for some specific topics, which is really a good opportunity to explore different things.

In the exam he tested things that were mostly mentioned in the course(but may not be on the slides since u know nothing from looking at pictures), so attend the course!
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm: mean
Final: Above near 1 sd
Project: 16/25 (Probably below mean)
Class Participation: 6 times
I got a B+.
Not too bad, I guess it's just a typical ust grading scheme.
reviews.comment_workload: I gave it a C is because we need to do a group project and 2 exams in a semester. Comparing to other common courses, it's a little bit heavy.

reviews.author: larp sarp
reviews.title: Good grade, easy exams and nice professor
reviews.comment_content:
PART I: BIOLOGY, SEX AND GENDER
PART II: INEQUALITY IN EVERYDAY LIFE
PART III MEN AND WOMEN IN THE WORKPLACE AND AT HOME
PART IV: MEN AND WOMEN IN INTIMATE RELATIONSHIPS
PART V:  MEN AND WOMEN IN THE GLOBAL ECONOMY

Content wise, it's actually pretty interesting if you are someone that likes reading about topics like feminism and gender. You could learn quite a lot of something new, it might get slightly repetitive sometimes though.
reviews.comment_teaching: Julian is one of the nicest professors I've met in UST. You can tell he is actually interested in what he teaches and he tries to engage with everyone as much as possible. He doesn't just read from the slides and he adds his own insights.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment (it's a group project) 20%
Midterm Examination 30%
Final Examination 40%
Attendance/participation10% (5% for attendance, 5% for participation)

Midterm: 28/32 (mean: 23.52/32, SD:5.09/32)
Final: 36/40 (mean:26.93/40, SD: 5.86/40)
Group assignment: 17.5/20 (mean: 16.29/20, SD: 1.78/20)
Participation: don't know, but I talk quite frequently
Overall: A

Honestly, I was expecting an A+ LOL but I guess an A is good enough. The midterm and the final are MC and the content is based on the things he talks about in lessons, the readings and his slides.
reviews.comment_workload:
Overall, it is okay, but I could see why some people would find it unmanageable. Like I said, the midterm and the final are based on the things he talks about in lessons, the readings and his slides, so you do need to do the readings and they are quite a lot.

But the professor would go through the main points of each reading and give you a synopsis on lessons, so attending lessons is important. I think as long as you attend and pay attention to most lessons, you would do fine.

And for the group project, you just need to do a report on a topic/social gender phenomenon you choose on your own. The workload is okay as long as you have decent group mates. Luckily, mine were quite nice.

reviews.author: Khushi Chawla
reviews.comment_content:
The content is nice. We talk about gender differences in schools and offices and in society in general.
Part 1: Biology sex and gender
Part 2: Inequality in Everyday life
Part 3: Men and women in the workplace
Part 4: Men and women in Intimate relationships
Part 5: Men and women in the global economy
Part 6: Conclusion
reviews.comment_teaching: I think the prof is very good and knowledgeable of his field. He is very helpful if you have any doubts, and makes the course very interesting by showing different studies and videos.
reviews.comment_grading:
We had a midterm, a final, and 1 group project.
Midterm - 22.5/32 (mean 22)
Final - 31.5/40 (mean 29?)
Grp Project - 19.5/20 (mean 16)
I think the grading is good and very clear
Got A-
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is very light for a 3 credit course according to me. We had one reading after every class which was very interesting. And the group project (4 members), was to conduct a study where we break a gender stereotype, this was very interesting to perform.

reviews.author: Katerina Joy
reviews.title: Easy class if you're passionate in gender equality
reviews.comment_content:
PART I: BIOLOGY, SEX AND GENDER
PART II: INEQUALITY IN EVERYDAY LIFE
PART III MEN AND WOMEN IN THE WORKPLACE AND AT HOME
PART IV: MEN AND WOMEN IN INTIMATE RELATIONSHIPS
PART V:  MEN AND WOMEN IN THE GLOBAL ECONOMY
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Julian Groves is a very good professor, one of the best professor I've had this semester!
the class is very interactive as Professor Julian will ask multiple questions regarding the reading that was assigned each week. attendance is required and you have to turn on your camera in class.

Try your best to read and understand the reading so you can answer the questions in class (all the answer to the questions is in the reading). If you didn't read the required readings, try to write down/memorize the answer to Professor Julian's question as they WILL be in the midterms and finals

Overall the class was really fun for me as I am very passionate to learn more about gender studies
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm
   - My grade: 31/32
   - Mean: 23.52/32
   - SD: 5.09

Exam
   - My grade: 39/40
   - Mean: 26.93/40
   - SD: 5.86

Assignment/Project
    - My grade: 17.5/20
    - Mean: 16.29/20
    - SD: 1.78

Overall: A
grading was in my opinion fair, like I mentioned if you're passionate in this topic and pay attention in class, read the required readings it'll be easy to get an A
reviews.comment_workload:
1-2 Required readings each week
- the reading varies from 2 pages up to 10 pages (these are important as the questions the professor gives on the topic of the reading will be the question for the midterms and finals)

1 Group project - find a good teammate so you can brainstorm the topic and work well together

Mid-term and final - said it multiple times READ THE REQUIRED READINGS!

reviews.author: 浪漫的小貓
reviews.title: 喜出望外既靚grade!
reviews.comment_content: 主要講述係Home, School, Society入面gender inequality既狀況，通常都係common sense。溫書要睇下ppt同reading (但我其實關於reading d mc都係撞)，感覺都ok
reviews.comment_teaching: 呢個prof比較mono-tone，每堂大概會有5-10mins break time，佢會不停問問題等你parti，如果真係無人答就會點名 (不過都好少)
reviews.comment_grading:
靚！！！
project踩mean
midterm above 0.5 sd
final above 0.5 sd
Final grade = A
(本身睇以前space呢個%大概攞B+，真係嚇親!)
可能parti真係好重要
reviews.comment_workload: 幾乎每堂佢都會想你睇完required reading黎答問題，有啲reading真係好鬼長，導致我好多都唔睇了，如果你想r多啲parti就建議要睇完上堂。project黎講可以揀拍片/交paper (max 10 pages)，內容其實都易handle。呢個course唔計睇reading其實真係好輕鬆！

reviews.author: Tania SIu
reviews.title: Good Grade course
reviews.comment_content:
BIOLOGY, SEX, AND GENDER
INEQUALITY IN EVERYDAY LIFE
MEN AND WOMEN IN THE WORKPLACE AND AT HOME
MEN AND WOMEN IN INTIMATE RELATIONSHIPS
MEN AND WOMEN IN THE GLOBAL ECONOMY

These are the 5 modules. The third and fourth ones are the longest.
The content is very interesting. I highly recommend to study it not only because it is a good grade course, but also because it will inspire you and raise your awareness about gender inequality in society. You will also learn some shocking rituals.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor likes interactions with students. He will answer your questions (in class and after class), but sometimes I think he didn't answer the questions clearly.

The class is chill and fun overall. There were many videos to watch and two guest speakers.

Professor uploaded the class slides after class.
Sometimes you need to take notes, such as answers to the question about the reading because it will come up at the exam and you do not want to look back to the long lectures to find the answers.
reviews.comment_grading:
Project 20% (at most 10 pages long report)
Midterm Examination 30% (Mostly MC, 1 to 2 short question)
Final Examination 40% (Mostly MC, 1 to 2 short question)
Attendance/participation 10% (5% for attendance, 5% for participation)

The grading standard of the project was not revealed.

The exam is not hard IF you pay attention in class. Only some concept words and examples need to memorize, but all are simple examples. (Professor said it is not a memory test but you still need to memorize the concepts words) Some answers are on the powerpoints, some are answered in class (from the reading). If you understand it in class, you don't need too much effort in revising.

Participation: you need to answer questions about the required reading or ask questions. Contribution to the class discussion is count as participation.

Project 14/20
Midterm 31/32 (Mean 23.52; Median 24.5; SD 5.09)
Final 33/40 (Mean 26.93; Median 27.0; SD 5.86)

Final Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
You have about two months to complete one project so no worries.
The workload is not high if you do not want to read through the reading and gain participation marks. The length of the reading varies: some readings are demanding(>30 pages), some are short (1 to 5 pages). Or you can ask more questions to gain participation marks.

The presentation might be needed if there is time. Only two groups presentedin this term.

reviews.author: Yau
reviews.title: Quite fun if youre interested in it
reviews.comment_content:
BIOLOGY,SEX AND GENDER
INEQUALITY IN EVERYDAY LIFE
MEN AND WOMEN IN THE WORKPLACE AND AT HOME
MEN AND WOMEN IN INTIMATE RELATIONSHIPS
MEN AND WOMEN IN THE GLOBAL ECONOMY
reviews.comment_teaching: no lecture video. Prof. likes to upload his slides after the whole chapter ends. It is quite important to take notes because some info may not appear in powerpoint. He is nice and like to interact with students in lesson. If you answer his question, he will give you participation mark . There are videos and guest lecture, quite fun.
reviews.comment_grading:
for me, it is not hard to get b range. The midterm and final is quite easy and no need put a lot of effort and time to revise IF you pay attention in the lesson and take some notes. The concept and some terms are supported with examples so it is not hard to remember.
he

Assignment (project+ presentation(if needed) ) 25%
Midterm Exam 35%
Final Exam(cumulative)40%
Extra Credit:
Up to 5 percent extra credit may be awarded to individual students who make regular and outstanding contributions to the in-class discussions, or who frequently ask relevant questions.


midterm: 85.29/100
Mean: 71.3
SD: 17.26

project 88/100

final (for those who want letter grade) 84.21/100
mean:72.97
SD:14.06

get a B+
reviews.comment_workload:
not much workload. midterm, final(accumulate) and one group project. The topics of project is different. We can choose topic about HK protest this semester. It is ok if your groupmates are responsible, actually the project can be finished smoothly if you divide your work, just do your own part.

Some required reading. The content will be asked in the lesson so you can get the participation mark. But it is still ok to ignore the reading because he will explain it in lesson.

reviews.author: Jaymi
reviews.title: interesting course ! grade is fair if you're ok with a B
reviews.comment_content:
- this is a very interesting course about gender
- and how society has affected how we treat people of different genders
- why people still unconsciously follow irrational gender roles
- how gender stereotypes come to be
- how we can be more mindful when making judgements
- inspiring content, syllabus is attached for reference
- no hard concepts
- motivates you to think more insightfully
- sometimes we watch documentaries so it's cool
- good for if you're interested in humanities, science/engg ppl may find it too abstract
reviews.comment_teaching:
- prof groves is friendly and nice, the classroom environment is interactive as it is a small class
- his lectures are clear and easy to understand
- he has a no laptop/phone policy in class though, but i think this is a reasonable rule to respect
- 5 mins break in class, nice
- no attendance required but since not everything is in the ppt, you better go
reviews.comment_grading:
exams consists of ~30 MC questions and ~3 easy short answers questions. not too hard if you listen in class and study the reading materials.

the prof sets some questions from each lesson's content, so be sure to study all the ppt before taking the exam

- midterm : 84.38/100
- final : 84.88/100
(mean for both exmas are around 78 )
- group project : 85/100

is a fair grade but was hoping to at least get an A-, got B instead

not absolute grading as i know it, i also don't know how others did
reviews.comment_workload:
- reading materials could be quite long but they are compulsory
- no assignment besides the group project
- group pj topic is usually to research something, the theme is different for each sem, attached is the set from this sem for reference
- i ended up carrying the whole group pj, it was obviously a heavy workload for me
- one 5 page report and one ppt/video is needed (presentation is optional and does not count towards the grade)
- prof pushed the final exam date one whole month earlier, this was also an added workload
- no other hw for each lesson

attachments.name: Gender and Society Syllabus Fall 18 sept 3

reviews.author: adrianliu
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor was very interactive with students. Lectures are well prepared with lots of real life examples and in-class activities. There are not a lot of content in powerpoints or notes. So although there is no attendance requirement, you have to attend the lectures as the contents and examples from impromptu in-class discussions will be tested.
reviews.comment_grading:
The graded parts are:
Group project
Midterm exam
Final exam

The grading of the group project is rather lax. Pretty much everyone gets >80%. Mine was slightly below mean (84-86) as we didn't really put much time and effort into the paper.

The exams are mostly in MC. It shouldn't be difficult provided that you have gone through all required reading. I got around mean +1.5SD in both exams.

My final grade: A
reviews.comment_workload: The group project is relatively easy. But there is a lot of required reading which is tested in the midterm and final exam (about 700 pages). It may be very difficult and time consuming for students with limited English ability. Otherwise, the workload of the course is very light with no regular assignments.

reviews.author: fokkakiu
reviews.comment_content: The content was easy to be understood. It is about some common issues topics on Gender, such as gender violence, gender in the working environment, dating, and other interesting topics about gender.
reviews.comment_teaching: Basically, you have to read all of the readings before you attend each lesson. The lesson will be conducted based on the readings every week. There will be some discussions concerning on the gender topics within the classroom during lessons, and the powerpoint basically only pictures and examples, so you just need to read every reading to understand the topics.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm: 80.65/100 (above half SD)
Final: 73.68/100 (mean)
Project: 90/100 (above one SD)
Grade: B
reviews.comment_workload:
Midterm: MC + Short Questions
Final: MC + Short Questions
Project based on one gender issues.

reviews.author: Szczesny
reviews.title: Groves' courses have been infamous for its weird grading
reviews.comment_content:
The course is divided into 5 parts

1. Biological sex and gender
2. Inequality in everyday life
3. Men and women in the workplace and the home
4. Men and women in intimate relationships
5. Men and women in the global economy

Content seems to be quite interesting as they are gender topics.

However, when it comes to the real deal, that is not the case. I can learn little things from this course as there is not having any in-depth discussions in class.
reviews.comment_teaching:
No phone and notebook in class

Professor tried to show us more short videos and documentaries to make the classes more interesting

Sometimes professor talked in a very soft and slow manner, making lectures boring.
reviews.comment_grading:
mid-term exam: 35% (+0.8 s.d.)
project: 25% (-0.6 s.d.)
final exam: 40% (+0.2 s.d.)

Final grade: B (This grade will also be decided by the participation credit that you get)

mid-term exam= 28 mcs+ 3 very short questions
final exam= 35 mcs+ 3 very short questions

mean for exams are quite high, ~75-80%

ATTENTION: MAXIMUM OF EXTRA 10% CREDIT ARE GIVEN TO SOME STUDENTS FOR PARTICIPATING IN CLASS DISCUSSION.

The grading criteria in any Groves' course is absurd, especially the participation credits he gave. Groves has no standard in granting credits, sometimes he could grant someone 5% extra participation credits simply because she made a 3-min promotion about her club's event (related to sociology) during class. Even someone contributed to class discussions every lecture, Groves still couldn't manage to recognize those faces, and end up giving them little or even no participation points.

If you are an introvert, think twice before you enrolled in any Groves' course as you will definitely get no extra credit from Groves for being "quiet", and then your grade is over. Even you did very well in individual assessments, say A-range, those 10% credits given with no standard at all is going to pull down your grades by 1 to 2 sub-band.
reviews.comment_workload:
There are a total of 15 required readings, ranging from 2 to 20 pages per reading, the content are not difficult to understand. You must read and understand them thoroughly since the content will be tested in the mid-term and final exam. You have to read 1 passage per week, which could quite be a workload for someone.

Though attendance is not a must, but you are urged to attend all those classes. Everything included in classes will be tested in the exams. NO LECTURE VIDEOS IN CANVAS!!!

The Powerpoint slides are easy to follow. However, make sure you never skip classes, since professor will make further discussions in lectures, and the ideas emerged from the discussions will also be tested in the exams. Not to mention that there are slight differences between in-class Powerpoint slides and slides from Canvas.

Sometimes professors will show some videos, and invite some guest speakers to give a talk. Pay attention to what are said, again, because they are going to be included in the exams

THIS COURSE IS OF VERY LOW WORKLOAD (IF YOU DON'T SPEAK IN CLASS).

reviews.author: Eunji
reviews.comment_content: During lectures, he usually brings up a discussion question for the class to talk about. To make the class more interesting, he also show us short video clips about gender. Most of his power point notes are from the required or supplementary readings he gave us.
reviews.comment_teaching: He knows how to keep the class active by asking questions and showing us interesting video clips.
reviews.comment_workload: The required readings are long, but otherwise it was okay. The group project might takes a long time, depending on your luck of having a good group or not.

reviews.author: bpw
reviews.title: Gender and Society
reviews.comment_content: Various interesting topics regarding to gender, for example, women rights and glass ceiling, were covered in class, on notes as well as in assigned readings. Things I learnt in class can also used in daily life discussion on other matters within sociological aspects.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Groves often tried to make the class lively by adding videos, interesting discussions and even inviting people to give talks.
reviews.comment_grading: Grades are generally good but it's highly competitive, which means you will have to score very high in midterm and final in order to get an A. (It's probably because the midterm and final examinations were easy and they were in the form of MCQ. There were 2-3 short questions in the final too.)
reviews.comment_workload: There were only 1-2 compulsory reading each week and an intriguing little group project (in 4-5 people size) with a presentation to be done throughout the semester. You can choose to write a report or shoot a video and my group chose to write a report. There were also midterm and final. But there was no quiz. There was also no additional assignments.

reviews.author: Weird Guy
reviews.comment_content: The content covered gender in the workplace, gender in violence, issues such as homosexuality, and the development of gendered traits (males are supposed to be competitive, while females are supposed to be caring). This course really opens up everyone's mind and I recommend students to take this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Brilliant. Dr. Groves is one of the best professors in UST. A lot of discussions take place in the classes. He actively engages students into contributing ideas in the class. He invites guest speakers to talk about the gender issues in the workplaces of Hong Kong.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is quite ok. His exams are easy, as the means are really high. Participating in class gives extra credit though.
reviews.comment_workload:
This course consists of a midterm, final, and a group project about the breaking of a gender stereotype. One has to read the required readings before classes. Though the readings appear daunting, the Professor just wants you to get the main idea and will emphasise on this in his slides. The midterm and final do not require much study, as long as one attends his classes. His questions are very conceptual and covers the discussions in class. The group project is quite simple and does not require a lot of effort.
I would recommend to attend his office hours before the exam as he gives valuable advice for the exam.

reviews.author: Jennifer
reviews.title: Good course to choose
reviews.comment_content: The purpose of this course is to answer these questions and others by developing a sociological mindfulness about how gender operates in our society. By sociologically mindful, I mean that we will view gender as the product of culture, groups, and organizations. I also mean that we will be paying attention to behaviours and ways of thinking that are so taken-for-granted that we often fail to question them, with an eye to examining the nature of inequality between men and women.  The course will be organized around five main topics: 1. Gender and Biology 2. Gender and Everyday Life  3. Gender at Work and in the Home  4. Gender and Intimate Relationships and 5. Gender in the Global Economy.  The focus of our discussions will be on gender issues in Hong Kong.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is really a good teacher. He initiates many discussion during the lesson in order to help us to understand more on the required readings. He also invites organisations outside to give us talk in order to provide us more information in the reality.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment and presentation (if applicable) 25%
Midterm Exam 35%
Final Exam (cumulative) 40%  

Assignment is all about gender stereotype. Do an experiment and hand in written report or video, if have time need presentation.

No need to take attendance
reviews.comment_workload:
Normal workload
Assignment can be done real fast, really depends on your group mates.
Better to read the required readings before each lesson, coz he will have discussion about that. If you are really interested in the topics, you can read the extra readings he given.
No attendance but better attend lesson, coz he will examine things taught not just on the notes.

reviews.author: CatJin
reviews.title: Very good, highly recommend it
reviews.comment_content: The content is well designed and there are plenty of interesting things you can learn and be amazed. During and after the course, you may be able to understand why some of the gender issues are happening in this world in a more thorough and concrete manner. The content covers issue just as women in workplace, lesbian/gay, sexist language, and many more.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Groves is amazing teacher. He presents idea very well in a very concise and sometimes funny manner. He likes to engage students in the class and listen to different opinions. I would definitely want to take many other courses he teaches next year
reviews.comment_grading: His grading is okay I think. you should get 90+ to get A range.
reviews.comment_workload: Not a lot of workload. There are many reading materials assigned. At the end, there is surely not enough time to read them all but most of the core ideas in the material (but not all) are covered in the lecture. (so don't miss it). There is a group project but its fun and interesting.

reviews.author: vs
reviews.title: Amazing professor!
reviews.comment_content: 2740 offers good insight into Gender Sociology, but it might feel one sided/too narrowly focused if you don't have a burning passion for Gender Studies/introductory Sociology knowledge. Having said that, it definitely changed the way I view the world. If you're just looking to fulfill an SA, I'd recommend 1850 with the same prof: varied, interesting, rich intro to Sociology. Groves is a brilliant lecturer.
reviews.comment_teaching: Brilliant lecturer. Engaging, interesting, has almost a stage presence. Best lecturer I've yet had. Groves implements case study + example-based learning approach, with supplementary videos and guest speakers. When I took it I think we had four guest speakers peppered throughout the term.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair. I don't know if many people (or if any) break the A+ ceiling though. Grading is based on midterm, final, one group project [in which the group is assigned to transgress a gender norm and write a report on it], and in-class participation. I did fairly well in the exams [mean+1sd] and got the mean for the group project, but participated like heck [because I genuinely love the subject] and got an A grade
reviews.comment_workload: Pretty light, just make sure you attend most lectures and keep [somewhat] up to date with assigned readings. There are two types of readings - assigned (therefore mandatory) and optional. You don't have to bother reading the optional readings, although they are often very interesting and relevant to the course. Other than that, finding a suitable/novel [if innovative, gets a nod from prof] topic for the group project may be tough, but everything else is pretty chill. Optional presentation [if there is time during the semester] of selected group projects.

reviews.author: zebra
reviews.title: (Online)Attention to class and good memory is important!
reviews.comment_content:
Really changes your mind in how you see gender!

PART I: BIOLOGY, SEX AND GENDER
PART II: INEQUALITY IN EVERYDAY LIFE
PART III MEN AND WOMEN IN THE WORKPLACE AND AT HOME
PART IV: MEN AND WOMEN IN INTIMATE RELATIONSHIPS
PART V:  MEN AND WOMEN IN THE GLOBAL ECONOMY
reviews.comment_teaching:
Quite a lot of videos to watch in class, about 1 a week I think?
Very interactive, always always asks us questions.
Prof. would also give us readings to read before class. If you wanna earn participation points, then you'd better read (most of the time 10+ pages).
For those who are lazy, just pay attention to the questions that are asked in class, and remember them, then your grade is going to be ok!
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment/Project
    - My grade: 18.5/20
    - Mean: 16.29/30
    - SD: 1.78
    (p.s. my group was one of the 2 groups who were asked to do a presentation in class)

Midterm
   - My grade: 28/32
   - Mean: 23.52/32
   - SD: 5.09

Exam
   - My grade: 30/40
   - Mean: 26.93/40
   - SD: 5.86

Participation
   - No idea, probably just mean

Overall: A-
(You would need to score nearly full marks in both midterm and exam if you want an A)
reviews.comment_workload:
1 Group Assignment
    - You hand this in around 2 months into the semester
    - Requires you to think of an experiment that breaks a gender norm (e.g. boys wearing makeup). You would have to do the actual thing and observe how others react. Since it was an online semester, my group uploaded videos on it and asked visitors to fill in a survey
    - If you wanna score high, make sure you are real creative

1 Midterm
    - 1-2 SQ, 20-30 MC
    - relatively easy (prof. says it's not a memory test, but you'd really need to remember the details actually)

1 Exam (Accumulative)
   - 1-2 SQ, 30-40 MC
   - slightly harder than the mid-term since there is more to remember

reviews.author: neimamihaibin
reviews.title: gender n society
reviews.comment_content: its quite interesting if you would like to study more about the society and discover ideas and things that you might not even look at in daily
reviews.comment_teaching: not bad. the professor is quite funny and there are videos in lesson although i have only went to the lecture for few times as it is sometimes boring
reviews.comment_grading: not bad, there is participation mark. midterm is quite easy too
reviews.comment_workload: just a group prject and groupmates are all here to share the same workload. one midterm n final then thats all

reviews.author: S. Doggy
reviews.title: 2780 modernization
reviews.comment_content: 由中國改革開放前講到近期的中國, 有歷史認識的同學可能比較易上手。同時有唔少人當common core讀, 內容亦唔算深。
reviews.comment_teaching:
Alvin的教學風格非常輕鬆, 間中講爛gag自己笑, 每日飲可樂提神。
上堂比較少用片/圖, 主要係以講故仔的形式教書。
佢好著重你要上堂。
reviews.comment_grading:
個人覺得比較鬆手同埋佢唔會介意字數, 只要中point+表達清晰就一定唔會低分。
科大入面少有的Absolute grading, 所以全班個mean好高好近都唔怕, 真係好過拉curve好多。
reviews.comment_workload: 每個星期都會有一個細quiz(一條essay), 但基本上有上堂肯寫幾隻字就滿分。同時每個星期都會有幾份reading, reading的量雖然都幾大, 但同上堂講既野有好多重複, 所以唔太必要睇。
